questions.question: His liver cancer was ........................ by years of drinking.
questions.description: To bring on is to cause something negative to happen.

questions.question: I ...................... my grandparents yesterday.
questions.description: To call on someone is to visit them.

questions.question: Even though the team had little chance of winning, their fans cheered them .................. throughout the match.
questions.description: To cheer somebody on is to support them by giving words of encouragement.

questions.question: I am having a bad day. I really need someone to cheer me ..................
questions.description: To cheer somebody up is to try to make them happier.

questions.question: Raju has .......................... with a brilliant idea for a TV show.
questions.description: To come up with an idea is to introduce it.

questions.question: I was going to leave on Monday but something ..................... and I had to cancel the trip.
questions.description: Come up can be used to talk about an unexpected occurrence.

questions.question: '......................', said the teacher to the visitor.
I ............... some old photos while cleaning the cupboard.
We were discussing some private matters when mother ........................
questions.description: To cut in is to interrupt someone while they were talking.

questions.question: Grandmother always ............................ to bring us little gifts.
questions.description: To drop in or drop by is to stop by for a visit.

questions.question: When I am late, my brother drops me ................... at work.
questions.description: To drop somebody off is to leave them in their destination.

questions.question: They made a sincere effort to save their marriage but in the end it ......................
questions.description: When a marriage falls apart, it fails.
